meanings.definition: The quality or state of being newsworthy.
meanings.sent1: The newsinesses of the story made it to the front page.
meanings.sent2: Her article lacked newsinesses, so it wasn't published.
meanings.sent3: The cat's adventures had a surprising amount of newsinesses.
meanings.sent4: The newsinesses of the event captured everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The newsinesses of the scandal spread like wildfire.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being related to news.
meanings.sent1: The newsinesses of the press conference was undeniable.
meanings.sent2: His job involves analyzing the newsinesses of current events.
meanings.sent3: The newsinesses of the weather report made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The newsinesses of the situation was like a magnet for reporters.
meanings.sent5: The newsinesses of the breaking news was electrifying.
